line_1: 'And O! be sure to fear the LORD alway!
line_2: The youngkers a' are warned to obey;

line_1: 'And O! be sure to fear the LORD alway!
line_2: And ne'er, tho' out o' sight, to jauk or play:

line_1: 'And O! be sure to fear the LORD alway!
line_2: Lest in temptation's path ye gang astray,

line_1: To this dark Den, where Sickness toss'd alway.
line_2: Stretch'd on his Back a mighty Lubbard lay,

line_1: To this dark Den, where Sickness toss'd alway.
line_2: Heaving his Sides, and snored Night and Day;

line_1: To this dark Den, where Sickness toss'd alway.
line_2: And his half-open'd Eyne he shut strait way:

line_1: Yet still my thoughts revert always
line_2: Now on the raging deep I gaze,
